query: What inconsistencies exist in Gulfstream's explanation of delays?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: What inconsistencies exist in Gulfstream's explanation of delays?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Joe Rivera Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Here are two additional impeachment sequences for cross-examining Joseph Rivera—one on staffing failures and one on discrepancy management failures—each crafted to corner him on internal inconsistencies, undermine credibility, and support a mismanagement narrative.

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.5]

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.10]

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.10]
emails unless manually preserved. No automated backups exist. Although Gulfstream produced

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.11]
legal and operational expectations. It is unclear what systems, if any, exist to ensure retention of

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.22]
circumstances that existed when the contract was made, not those extant at the time of the suit.

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.22]
Procedural unconscionability exists where the weaker party had no realistic alternative to

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.23]
